lexUnit.name: herd.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to bring together a large group or class of people

sentence.text: So long as the Squigs are successfully herded by the prodder-armed Night Goblins they are moved and fight just like any other unit .

East of Lake Baikal several clans of Evenki Tungus who had formerly herded reindeer went over to horseriding and were partly assimilated to the Buryats , especially in the context of native cossack units .
Men were herding mares and their foals away from the water , and a few women were washing clothes beside the shore .
Four men-at-arms rode alongside , and bringing up the rear was another monk herding a flock of sheep and goats .
Emaciated , servile , exhausted , Stepan and Ilya Holovich found themselves herded with a hundred thousand others into the Displacement Camps .
The visitors were herded into two large halls , which were once the hotel ballroom and dining room .
Soldiers herded 50,000 Hindus onto buses and trains out of Ayodhya , where the violence was sparked by the destruction of a Moslem mosque .
where Trevor Rowley has been able to explain the many routeways as a reflection of the straker routes of commoners herding animals from lowland settlements to upland pastures .
Except in the case of the stallion deliberately herding his mares , this is not a question of dominance or bullying .
I had a sudden mental picture of a struggling and reluctant group of climbers being herded into a minibus bound for Anglesey by Dunne , Littlejohn et al .
Peter waved and herded Sebastian into the brightness of the clubhouse .
In the Kingsbury furniture store opposite W H Smith , manager Davie Glover , 39 , claimed police were herding his staff the wrong way .
He herded us into the lobby , which was full of people .
" I 'm not spending the time ploughing the Cochlea fever-steppes or herding Tyyrkyn mountain pigs .
Last March a small flock of advanced to expert skiers were herded down the most terrifying terrain in Chamonix by Nigel Shepherd .
In Milan the victims and suspected victims -- and it is hard to believe that non-sufferers ever survived being suspected sufferers -- were herded in to a custom-built enclosure .
Some survivors complained they were being herded towards the site of the second bomb and were only 50 ft away when it exploded .
Peasants tilled the soil and herded sheep .
The bull and cows were being herded along the road at Calne , Wilts , when he suddenly ran wild with lust .
Puppies will herd hens in a farmyard , just as a pack of wolves will encircle an ailing prey .
